title: Adjectives - comparative or superlative?
instructions: Complete the sentences with the B1comparativeB2 or B1superlativeB2 forms of the adjectives. Sometimes you will need to supply 'the'.

sentence: I don't have free time. I'm
explain: Corr: busier. There's 'than' after the adjective, so we need the comparative form.
Corr: more dangerous. We need the comparative because there's 'then' in the sentence.
Corr: more important. We need the comparative because there's 'than' in the sentence.
Corr: the most expensive. We need the superlative form.
Corr: more. We need the comparative form because there's 'than' in the sentence.
Corr: faster. We need the comparative form because there's 'than' in the sentence.
Corr: the kindest. We need the superlative because we want to express that nobody is kinder than Joe.
Corr: easier. We need the comparative because there's 'than' in the sentence.
Corr: farther. We need the comparative because there's 'than' in the sentence.
Corr: darker. We need the comparative because there's 'than' in the sentence.
